title: Iraqi Kurds celebrate victory after independence vote
description:
(27 Sep 2017) Thousands celebrated in Kurdish cities in northern Iraq after a referendum on independence took place on 25 September. 
The referendum passed with more than 92 percent of voters approving independence, the Kurdish region's election commission told a news conference on Wednesday. 
Turnout was over 72 percent, it said.
In the city of Dohuk, people were dancing, waving flags, honking their car horns and fired fireworks.
Despite such strong support, however, the non-binding vote was unlikely to lead to formal independence, even as it escalated long-running tensions with Baghdad. 
Iraq and its neighbours, along with virtually the entire international community, oppose any redrawing of the map.
